body: Hi, please merge the master to make ci more stable.
@qiaojialin  Done.

IMO, 
Debug log is dense, 50 ~ 100M per file is ok.
For info log, 10~50M is fine.
For error log, 2M is too small, maybe 10M is fine.

3 days passed, @qiaojialin  any suggestions?
If not, @WeiZhong94 , can you solve the travis conflict ? (The travis is simplified now, you just need to add the new module into the code-coverage test).

Besides, I see some CI failed because the mqtt dependency is not found from maven repo.

It is strange that the "IoTDB-Flink Examples" failed because of that issue.

However, it inspires me that you should claim the mqtt maven repo address on mqtt-example module, too. It is because some users may just compile the example module (and skip compiling the server module). Then, On their local repo folder, there is no such a jar, and error will occurs.

> IMO,
> Debug log is dense, 50 ~ 100M per file is ok.
> For info log, 10~50M is fine.
> For error log, 2M is too small, maybe 10M is fine.

Hi, thanks for your opinion. I'd love to take your advice : )

@jixuan1989 Thanks for your notification, I have rebased this PR on top of the master branch.

@jixuan1989 I think have fixed the ci error, but it's strange that the ci build not automatic triggered.
> However, it inspires me that you should claim the mqtt maven repo address on mqtt-example module, too. It is because some users may just compile the example module (and skip compiling the server module). Then, On their local repo folder, there is no such a jar, and error will occurs.

mqtt-client jar in the maven central repo, but moquette jar is not in (which is in https://jcenter.bintray.com). 

It's unnecessary to add moquette maven repo address on mqtt-example module, because the mqtt-example is only dependent on mqtt-client. So it is OK even with users just build the example module.

> @jixuan1989 I think have fixed the ci error, but it's strange that the ci build not automatic triggered.

Yeah  it is quite strange... 
I manually trigger it and let's wait for the result.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1021782/78743329-e86e0f80-7990-11ea-8386-721bad3c7092.png)

@jixuan1989 
Now there is a tsfile test error which is unrelated to mqtt after I merged the master to current branch.
Maybe someone should fix it first. And we should take effort to keep the master branch always passing the CI.

thrift 0.13.0 used by the stand-alone IoTDB will cause bugs in Mac OS and that is why we use a separate version in the distributed version.
PLEASE, do not merge any outside code without informing the committers who are working on this branch.

> thrift 0.13.0 used by the stand-alone IoTDB will cause bugs in Mac OS and that is why we use a separate version in the distributed version.
PLEASE, do not merge any outside code without informing the committers who are working on this branch.

If so, 
1. should we downgrade the thrift version in the server module?
2. add a comment on the top of the dependency in the cluster pom.xml to claim why you have to do that.

_Why the previous default value is true?_
As an IOT database, mqtt should be supported more natively (as a built-in service). And the service started by default is for the convenience of users.

_Do we need to let users know about this change?_
Yes, of course. I think we should specify the changes in the 0.10 release note.

_Can we change it to the default false?_
The reason why the default value is true is explained above. I'm OK for both. And I'm willing to listen to others.

+1 for  @vesense 
I also think it should be enable by default.
Can you give some reasons to explain why you want to disable it by default?

I think MQTT server just an extension connector. 
Opening up an extra port for infrequently used features can be very dangerous.

> Opening up an extra port for infrequently used features can be very dangerous.

you are right. But I think it is not the reason that we disable it. Instead, we need to:

1. guarantee there is no security problem in our implementation;
2. Only expose the port to authorized IPs by firewall.

> I think MQTT server just an extension connector.

How to say... maybe many companies use their customized TCP protocols, but MQTT is a symbolic meaning for IoT area.

What you said is very contradictory. Does MQTT communicate with clients or with background services?
If client, how to set authorized IPs?
If BG-server ,why not use thrift?

Hi,

Yes, when people use MQTT,  the scenario is let devices connect to the MQTT server directly.

Normally, the "device" is a car, a smart electric meter, etc..

If the "device" has a const IP, then you can use firewall to allow which IPs can access the port (Almost all Cloud platforms, aliyun, aws, etc., support that. Normally they are called ).

If the "device" has no a const IP, then maybe two solutions can be chosen:

1. The device reports its IP to someone and then be added into the firewall;
2. Use a complex USERNAME/PASSWORD in MQTT protocol.

I think how to guarantee the MQTT port safety is not the focus of this discussion.

I think  whether we enable the port by default just depends on what role we want IoTDB plays:

- Do we want to wave the flag that "IoTDB is for IoT area. Therefore, it put the international Standards in IoT area in priority."
Well, hopefully it will prompt the user at the time of publication that an mqtt-server is turned on and that the user remembers to change the default user password

The current implementation is good, but not the best. The problem is that when replications are used, nodes will have overlapped timeseries. For example, node1,2,3 all have timeseries1,2,3, so 3 times as much timeseries will be transferred to respond to the query, let alone further deduplication.

My suggestion is: you should query each group instead of each node, and the queried node will know from the parameter `header` which group you are querying, so it will only send the timeseries that are actually managed by the node (Remember we use the storage group to partition timeseries schema).

It is up to you to make an improvement within this pr or start another pr. But if you choose the latter one, please supplement your idea in the related Jira issue.
